metadata.title: CVE-2022-20141 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In ip_check_mc_rcu of igmp.c, there is a possible use after free due toimproper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege whenopening and closing inet sockets with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product:AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-112551163References: Upstreamkernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-dell300x - 4.15.0-1030.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1055-gke - 5.4.0-1055.58~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1026-gkeop - 5.4.0-1026.27~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1098.104
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1115-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1115.124
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
